TopicTitle: So... Spaceplane Plus is added to the game!

Articles.Content: You'd think people would be happy, even if they don't like using planes, because this is the first 'advanced' addition to the game for so long i dare to think.
Don't get me wrong, I do like SP+ but the cargo bags are a bit small, though hopefully squad will add larger ones
Who said these parts are just for spaceplanes? I have so many plans for them... >:-)
Looks great, but will it also have RasterProp integrated for a great looking IVA?

Probably not. At least: nothing was mentioned.

I guess they made quite significant changes to the cockpit.

I'm doing all the rescue from kerbin orbit missions via SSTO spaceplanes now, they cost more to launch than a regular capsule-style rocket equivalent, but the overall cost of the mission after recovery is only a little bit of fuel

I do not have access to enough plane bits in my current save to make a decent one, but my rocket design works good enough to not warrant one. Once I have my station in orbit it will make the rescue missions infinitely easier, at least the idea for what I want to be on there.

I made several spaceplanes and atmospheric planes trying to convince myself that they're nice things... but in the end: rockets are my thing, I don't care much about aerospace. Still though - addition of a hangar bays is a huge thing, regardless of what one thinks about wings.

I am using universal storage, basically you can build bays onto rockets that actually look good. Not to mention if you get the science plugin it makes carrying science look much cleaner, and price is fairly balanced for the parts as well.

After seeing Scott Manley's introduction to SP+ I'm definitely looking forward its integration with stock. Hopefully those announced changes will also include better IVA for the inline cockpit but the rest looks great.

Unfortunately, that would also require the integration of the RasterPropMonitor mod into the stock game, and I think SQUAD would have announced that if it was going to happen.

It seems unlikely that a stock cockpit would include RPM support. On the other hand, since Porkjet made the effort to make the internal view compatible with RPM in the first place, I would expect an RPM patch pretty much as soon as the 'stock' variant is released.

Actually a quick question about SPP's integration - I've heard that the cargo bays are likely a go.. so does that mean the Firespitter plugin (or at least it's functionality) is becoming part of stock too?

You'd think people would be happy, even if they don't like using planes, because this is the first 'advanced' addition to the game for so long i dare to think.

I think adding an entire economic framework is a more advancing addition than a couple of shiny parts. I guess they're sleek, but what does that mean in terms of game fidelity, really.

I know parts, parts and more parts are what kids want, but there are a boatload of optimizing, balancing, backend tweaking KSP needs. So many of us are pining for the day FAR/NEAR is made stock that it's become a bit of a joke. That would be a truly advancing/game-changing update.

All the same, I'm glad to see some fleshing out of part types, plane parts have been on the meager side, and they're good-looking parts.

Gah! No, you're right - I was misreading. Sorry for the false alarm.

I think adding an entire economic framework is a more advancing addition than a couple of shiny parts. I guess they're sleek, but what does that mean in terms of game fidelity, really.

New economic framework is hardly a priority. Current one is fine - it's just completely unbalanced to the game that is about space flight and exploration of the solar system. You can research an entire tree and swim in cash without ever making a full orbit around Kerbin (sub-orbitals are good enough for majority of tasks and running around Kerbin, occasional escape trajectory with full-on vertical launch can speed up the process). Rewards are too high, deadlines too long, penalties too low, and the idea of making a system where player cannot go bankrupt came out to be a complete failure (as some expected).

I know parts, parts and more parts are what kids want,

2. It's not just parts - it's an added mechanic of cargo bays, something KSP never got before. And let's not forget about the lifting bodies, something that - again - KSP never had, though it's not as much of a mechanic as simply changing config to the parts.

but there are a boatload of optimizing, balancing, backend tweaking KSP needs

Porkjet's parts are only for the "mk2" line (the sort of SR-71 profiled parts).

The Mk1 (1.25m) parts have been overhauled by Hugo (allegedly), as well as the Mk3 (the weird offset 2.5m parts).

So all parts should still be there, just in an allegedly shinier form. (confirmedly shinier for mk2 parts)

I can imagine multiplayer as a business priority, but I cannot imagine how that works in any game that necessarily requires time compression. On topic, I too am hoping for a more realistic atmosphere to go with these awesome new spaceplane parts.
